TopicTitle: A goup is making an actual Earth-chan anime

Articles.Content:
You know that one meme from a few months ago? Earth-chan? And how it started out as a suggestion/concept for an anime? Well, some people (SOL Studios) are actually getting on doing that. Here's the discord: https://discord.gg/hKQcWsS

Edited March 12, 2018 by EnderKid2
Cory in the House is still a better anime.
Why Earth, why not Interstellar's Gargantua with neko ears.

6 hours ago, kerbiloid said:

Why Earth, why not Interstellar's Gargantua with neko ears.

I'd watch the hell out of that.

You know there are those anime or manga whatevers about warship girls and tank girls and stuff? Where are the rocket girls? I need my soyuz chan and falcon heavy senpai. 

Edited March 19, 2018 by A Soviet Tank

1 minute ago, A Soviet Tank said:

You know there are those anime or manga whatevers about warship girls and tank girls and stuff? Where are the rocket girls? I need my soyuz chan and falcon heavy senpai. 

Now that, I'd watch.

 

RIP N-1-chan.

2 hours ago, A Soviet Tank said:

You know there are those anime or manga whatevers about warship girls and tank girls and stuff? Where are the rocket girls? I need my soyuz chan and falcon heavy senpai. 

Ariane is best girl

8 minutes ago, Canopus said:

Ariane is best girl

Don't forget her little sister Vega.

6 hours ago, A Soviet Tank said:

You know there are those anime or manga whatevers about warship girls and tank girls and stuff? Where are the rocket girls? I need my soyuz chan and falcon heavy senpai. 

Well, really Soyuz would be the Senpai (older rocket family), and the Falcon would be the younger.

So... Soyuz senpai and Falcon 9 - chan? "Senpai" generally denotes seniority.

Hmm. After further though I am wondering how we distinguish the spacecraft girls from each other. For example do we class each module of the ISS as a individual spacecraft girl or is the ISS as a whole a single spacecraft girl? And how do rocket girls fit into this? Let's take Apollo 11, do we class the Apollo service module, lander and saturn V as separate spacecraft girls or do we group them into one being simply called Apollo 11? Damn this is really interesting.

2 hours ago, A Soviet Tank said:

Hmm. After further though I am wondering how we distinguish the spacecraft girls from each other. For example do we class each module of the ISS as a individual spacecraft girl or is the ISS as a whole a single spacecraft girl? And how do rocket girls fit into this? Let's take Apollo 11, do we class the Apollo service module, lander and saturn V as separate spacecraft girls or do we group them into one being simply called Apollo 11? Damn this is really interesting. 

Saturn V is the mother, Apollo CSM and LEM are the kids.

Edited March 21, 2018 by Canopus

Not exactly an anime, but there's a series called planetary moe, which is about celestial bodies personified as anime girls

Or if you are a hardcore aircraft nerd, try to read flight highschool, which is about aircraft personified as anime girls, with the plot usually reference the capabilities, events or characteristic about aircrafts. It comes with warning on the cover: "BEWARE OF NICHE GENRE . These comics may contain content normal people are unable to understand. If you understood all of the comics, I recommend you speak with a mental health expert."

Try it if you want to test how nerdy you are about aircraft

Edited March 23, 2018 by ARS

Are they anywhere as good as the original Gauge 1 scaled Thomas the Tank Engine ?

Sounds childish, but trust me, they're as good as the supermarionation Thunderbirds. (later they also had Tugs.)

(hint : I love the physical modelling. Computer-animated stuff just looks really silly. The stories were also good, at least until they had waay too many series.)
